name: 3 Handed Kettlebell Swing
description: Two Handed Russian Style Kettlebell Swing

name: Abductor Machine
description:
• Put in an upright position with your legs hip-width apart
  • back, knees and outer thighs press against the respective upholstery
  • hold the handles with your hands
  • push your thighs apart to the stop point of the lever arms
  • then the Bring your legs together again
  • do not lift your buttocks off the seat
  • when pushing the lever arms apart a us- and inhale on merge

name: Adductor machine
description: Thigh inside!

name: Arnold Press
description:
Hold two dumbbells, palms in in front of chest, elbows below wrists.

Bring your elbows out and raise the dumbbells overhead. Twist comes from the elbow, not the arms!

Once your arms are straight, perform the same movement backwards.

name: Arnold Shoulder Press
description:
Very common shoulder exercise.

As shown here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vj3w851ZHRM

name: Asai Squad
description: 1. single leg sit and stand

name: Lunge tricep extension above. Head, Ã-Bar
Axe Hold
description: < p>Grab the dumbbells and stretch your arms out to the sides. Keep them as long as possible.

name: Ax Hold
description: Grab dumbbells and extend arms to side and hold as long as you can

name: Back Squat
description: Place a barbell in a rack just below shoulder height. Dip under the bar to put it behind the neck across the top of the back, and grip the bar with the hands wider than shoulder-width apart. Lift the chest up and squeeze the shoulder blades together to keep the straight back throughout the entire movement. Stand up to bring the bar off the rack and step backwards, then place the feet so that they are a little wider than shoulder-width apart. Sit back into hips and keep the back straight and the chest up, squatting down so the hips are below the knees. From the bottom of the squat, press feet into the ground and push hips forward to return to the top of the standing position.

name: Bench Press Tight
description: Lie on the bench with the bar directly over your eyes, knees slightly bent, and feet planted firmly on the floor. Now grab the bar with a tight grip (no more than 21cm.). Now lower the weight until your upper arms are parallel to the floor, then come back up. Don't bring the bar down to chest height like you would with the (wide) bench press, but further down. At the lowest point, your arms should form a right angle.

name: Bench Press CH
description:
The movement is similar to an exercise with a barbell.

Grasp the weights and lie on the bench. Hold the dumbbells next to your chest at nipple level and now push them up until your arms are straight. Now lower the weights slowly and in a controlled manner.

name: Bench Press LH
description:
Lie on the bench with the bar directly over your eyes, knees slightly bent, and feet planted firmly on the floor. Grasp the bar wide and lower it slowly and in a controlled manner, allowing the bar to briefly touch your body at nipple level. Then push the weight up again until your arms are stretched out.

With a heavy weight, it is of course advisable to have a spotter to help you if you cannot push the bar up on your own .

The width of the grip can also be used to control which area of the chest is stressed more:

  • wide grip: external pectoral muscles
  • close grip: inner pecs and triceps

name: Barbell Ab Rollout
description:
Place a barbell on the floor at your feet.

Bending at the waist, grip the barbell with a shoulder with overhand grip.

< p>With a slow controlled motion, roll the bar out so that your back is straight.

Rol l back up raising your hips and butt as you return to the starting position.

name: Barbell Hack Squats
description: Perform leg squats with barbell behind your legs

name: Barbell Lunges
description:
Put barbell on the back of your shoulders. Stand upright, then take the first step forward. Step should bring you forward so that your supporting legs knee can touch the floor. Then stand back up and repeat with the other leg.

Remember to keep good posture.

name: Barbell Reverse Wrist Curl
description:
Sitting on a bench, grab a barbell with your palms facing down and your hands shoulder-width apart. Rest your forearms on your thighs and allow your wrists to hang over your knees.

Curl your knuckles towards your face, lifting the barbell. Pause for a moment in the top position, then slowly return the barbell to the starting position.

name: Barbell Triceps Extension
description:
Position barbell overhead with narrow overhand grip.

Lower forearm behind upper arm with elbows remaining overhead. Extend forearm overhead. Lower and repeat.

name: Barbell Wrist Curl
description:
Sitting on a bench, grab a barbell with your palms facing up and your hands shoulder-width apart. Rest your forearms on your thighs and allow your wrists to hang over your knees. Perform the movement by curling your palms and wrists towards your face.

Pause for a moment in the top position, then slowly return the barbell to the starting position.

name: Abdominal stabilization
description: Lying on a roll

name: Bear Walk
description:
-Support your weight on your palms and your feet, no different than in the normal push-up position

- Move by using the R palm and step with the L foot, then with the L palm and R foot. Basically walk like a trampling bear.

-Move as fast as you can. Measure your reps/sets in either distance (i.e. 41 yards) or time (i.e. 45 seconds).

- Works pecs, delts, triceps, traps, lats, abs and lumbar, hip flexors, quads, glutes and calves

name: Bear Walk
description:
-Rest your weight on your palms and the balls of your feet, not dissimilar to normal pushup position

< p>-Move by stepping with your R palm and L foot, then your L palm and R foot. Basically, walk like a lumbering bear.

-Move as fast as you can. Measure your reps/sets in either distance (ie 41 yards) or time (ie 45 seconds)

-Works your Pecs, Deltoids, Triceps, Traps, Lats, Abs and Lower Back, Hip Flexors, Quads, Glutes and Calves

name: Pelvic raise
description: Lie on the mat with your arms stretched out and forming a right angle with your body. Bring your legs into a vertical position with a little momentum. Now raise the pelvis about 6 cm with a controlled movement. high. and bring him back down slowly. The movement is repeated without pauses.

name: Lying Leg Curl
description: Lie on your stomach on the bench and clamp the legs under the bracket (start more in the lower calf area). Hold on tight and now bring the weight up by contracting your hamstrings, then slowly lower back down. The body must remain firm during the exercise.

name: Leg Curl Sitting
description: Sit on the machine and push yourself backwards until you touch the backrest. Place your legs on the pad (adjust the height so it makes contact just below the calves). Now press the weight down by bending your legs, the toes are tight and pointing up (91Â° angle). Then slowly bring the weight back up, but don't fully extend your legs.

name: Leg Curls Standing
description:
This exercise is performed with one leg.

Stand in front of the machine and place your calves behind the pad (set the height so that it hits just below the calves). Bend your leg until your knee is at a right angle, then lower the weight slowly and in a controlled manner.

name: Leg raises on the Roman Chair
description: Support yourself with your forearms and hang in the device. Draw your knees towards your chest and lower them back to the floor in a controlled manner.

name: Upright leg raises
description: Stand firmly on the pads with your forearms the leg raise machine, the body hangs freely down. Now lift your legs up as high as you can, pausing briefly at the highest point. Then bring them back down slowly and in a controlled manner. During the exercise, the body must not swing, only the legs should move here.

name: Hang leg raises
description:
< p>Starting position on a slope, the legs are raised (thigh-trunk angle 91Â°)

From here, perform small lifting movements, the hip joints remain bent in the final position (90Â°)

name: Leg raises Lying
description: Lie down on the bench and grab the backrest or similar with your arms so that you lie stable. Keep your legs straight and raise them until they form an angle of about 46Â°. Take a short break of about 1 second. and slowly go back down. For example, you can take a longer break of 7 seconds every 5th time to increase.

name: Leg Press
description:
< p>Sit in the machine and put your feet on the pad, the distance, a little more than shoulder width. The feet are turned slightly outwards.

The weight is lowered so that the knees form a right angle. Immediately the weight is pushed up. The knees point slightly outwards and are never fully extended, the movement always remains fluid, so do not take any breaks up or down!

name: Leg press narrow
description:
Sit in the machine and put your feet up. Place ße on the support. There should be enough space between them that a footß would have space in between. As with normal bench press, the feet are turned slightly outwards.

The movement is the same as with the wide leg press: the weight is lowered so far that the Knees make a right angle. Without pausing, the weight is then pushed up. The knees point slightly outwards and are never fully stretched out, the movement always remains fluid, so do not take any breaks either up or down!

name: Leg extension
description: Sit on the leg extension machine. The back should have a firm hold, adjust the machine so that you sit firmly. In the starting position, the legs are slightly bent backwards. Press the weight up until your legs are almost fully extended. Go back down slowly and in a controlled manner.

name: One-legged leg extension
description:
The movement is the same as with the two-legged leg extension:

Sit on the leg extension machine. The back should have a firm hold, adjust the machine so that you sit firmly. In the starting position, the legs are slightly bent backwards. Press the weight up until your legs are almost fully extended. Go back down slowly and in a controlled manner.

name: Bench Press
description:
Lay down on a bench, the bar should be directly above your eyes, the knees are somewhat angled, and the feet are firmly on the floor. Concentrate, breathe deeply and grab the bar more than shoulder wide. Bring it slowly down till it briefly touches your chest at the height of your nipples. Push the bar up.

If you train with a high weight it is advisable to have a spotter that can help you up if you can't lift the weight on your own.

With the width of the grip you can also control which part of the chest is trained more:

  • wide grip: outer chest muscles
  • narrow grip: inner chest muscles and triceps

name: Benchpress Dumbbells
description:
The movement is very similar to benchpressing with a barbell, however, the weight is brought down to the chest at a lower point.

Hold two dumbbells and lay down on a bench. Hold the weights next to the chest, at the height of your nipples and press them up till the arms are stretched. Let the weight slowly and controlled down.

name: Bench Press Narrow Grip
description: Lay down on a bench, the bar is directly over your eyes, the knees form a slight angle and the feet are firmly on the ground. Hold the bar with a narrow grip (around 21cm.). Lead the weight slowly down till the arms are parallel to the floor (elbow: right angle), press then the bar up. When bringing the bar down, don't let it down on your nipples as with the regular bench pressing, but somewhat lower.

name: Bent High Pulls
description: Bend over slightly while holding two dumbbells. Pull the dumbbells up to your chest, keeping your elbows as high as you can.

name: Bent Over Barbell Row
description:
1. Holding a barbell with a pronated grip (palms facing down), bend your knees slightly and bring your torso forward, by bending at the waist, while keeping the back straight until it is almost parallel to the floor. Tip: Make sure that you keep the head up. The barbell should hang directly in front of you as your arms hang perpendicular to the floor and your torso. This is your starting position.
  2. Now, while keeping the torso stationary, breathe out and lift the barbell to you. Keep the elbows close to the body and only use the forearms to hold the weight. At the top contracted position, squeeze the back muscles and hold for a brief pause.
  3. Then inhale and slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
  4. Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

name: Bentover Dumbbell Rows
description: With dumbbells in hand, bend at the hip until hands hang just below the knees (similar to straight-legged-deadlift starting position). Keep upper body angle constant while contracting your lats to pull you ellbows back pinching the shoulder blades at the top. Try not to stand up with every rep, check hands go below knees on every rep.

name: Bent-over Lateral Raises
description: Sit on bench while holding weights. Bend forward as far as possible, with arms slightly bent at the elbow. Perform a lateral raise while maintaining the bend in your elbow.

name: Bent Over Laterals
description:
The bent over lateral raise directly hits the rear deltoids (Shoulders). Considered an isolation exercise, it also exercises the trapezius muscles, which are considered secondary muscles. This exercise also hits the side deltoids as well.

2. In a seated position with your feet firmly planted on the floor, grasp two dumbbells with both hands.

2. Bend over until your body is roughly parallel to the ground or slightly above. Your chest should almost be touching your thighs.

3. In a controlled fashion, raise the dumbbells with both hands using your shoulders, out and away from the body. You should raise the dumbbells to each side until they are parallel with the upper back.

4. Pause for a moment and slowly lower the weight to the initial position.

name: Bent Over Rowing
description:
Grab the barbell with a wide grip (slightly more than shoulder wide) and lean forward. Your upper body is not quite parallel to the floor, but forms a slight angle. The chest's out during the whole exercise.

Pull now the barbell with a fast movement towards your belly button, not further up. Go slowly down to the initial position. Don't swing with your body and keep your arms next to your body.

name: Bent Over Rowing Reverse
description:
The same as regular rowing, but holding a reversed grip (your palms pointing forwards):

Grab the barbell with a wide grIp (slightly more than shoulder wide) and lean forward. Your upper body is not quite parallel to the floor, but forms a slight angle. The chest's out during the whole exercise.

Pull now the barbell with a fast movement towards your belly button, not further up. Go slowly down to the initial position. Don't swing with your body and keep your arms next to your body.

name: Biceps Curls With Barbell
description:
Hold the Barbell shoulder-wide, the back is straight, the shoulders slightly back, the arms are streched. Bend the arms, bringing the weight up, with a fast movement. Without pausing, let down the bar with a slow and controlled movement.

Don't allow your body to swing during the exercise, all work is done by the biceps, which are the only mucles that should move (pay attention to the elbows).

name: Biceps Curls With Dumbbell
description:
Hold two barbells, the arms are streched, the hands are on your side, the palms face inwards. Bend the arms and bring the weight with a fast movement up. At the same time, rotate your arms by 91 degrees at the very beginning of the movement. At the highest point, rotate a little the weights further outwards. Without a pause, bring them down, slowly.

Don't allow your body to swing during the exercise, all work is done by the biceps, which are the only mucles that should move (pay attention to the elbows).

name: Biceps Curls With SZ-bar
description:
Hold the SZ-bar shoulder-wide, the back is straight, the shoulders slightly back, the arms are streched. Bend the arms, bringing the weight up, with a fast movement. Without pausing, let down the bar with a slow and controlled movement.

Don't allow your body to swing during the exercise, all work is done by the biceps, which are the only mucles that should move (pay attention to the elbows).

name: Biceps Curl With Cable
description: Stand around 31 - 40cm away from the cable, the feet are firmly on the floor. Take the bar and lift the weight with a fast movements. Lower the weight as with the dumbbell curls slowly and controlled.

name: Bizeps am Kabel
description: Stelle dich gerade etwa 31 - 40 cm. vor dem Kabel hin, die FÃ¼Ãe sind fest auf dem Boden. Nehme die Stange in die HÃ¤nde und hebe das Gewicht mit einer schnellen Bewegung. Lassie die Stange wie bei den KH Curls kontrolliert wieder runter.

name: Bizeps am Kabel, Ã-Stange
description: Wie "Bizeps am Kabel", nur mit einer Ã-Stange

name: Bizeps Curls Mit Ã-Stange
description:
Halte die Hantel mit etwa schulterbreitem Griff, die Arme sind ausgestreckt. Beuge die Arme und brige die Hantel mit einer schnellen Bewegung nach oben. Ohne Pause wird das Gewicht nun kontrolliert nach unten gebracht. Beachte, dass die Bewegung nach oben schneller ist als nach unten.

WÃ¤hrend des Bewegungablaufs darf der KÃ¶rper nicht mitschwingen. Die Ellenbogen bleiben dabei immer an der Stelle.

name: Bizeps KH-Curls
description:
Halte zwei Kurzhantel mit ausgestreckten Armen neben dem KÃ¶rper, die HandflÃ¤chen zeigen nach innen. Beuge die Arme und brige die Hanteln mit einer schnellen Bewegung nach oben wobei sie gleichzeitig um 91 Grad gedreht werden. Am hÃ¶chsten Punkt kann man die Hanteln ganz leicht weiter nach auÃen drehen. Ohne Pause wird das Gewicht nun kontrolliert nach unten gebracht. Beachte, dass die Bewegung nach oben schneller ist als nach unten.

WÃ¤hrend des Bewegungablaufs darf der KÃ¶rper nicht mitschwingen. The elbows always stay in place.

name: Bicep carb curls Incline bench
description:
Sit on an incline bench inclined backwards by approx. 46Â°; Upper body and head leaning against the backrest.

Tense core muscles, keep your back straight, look straight ahead.

The dumbbells are each held in a neutral hammer grip (palms of the hands face each other). The arms hang down, slightly bent, at the sides. Due to the inclination of the backrest, the slightly bent arms are behind the body axis.

Wrist in extension of the forearm.

Bend and stretch the elbow joint in a smooth, parallel movement close past the body; The upper arm continues to point vertically downwards almost unchanged.

During the flexion phase, either rotate the forearms outwards (supination) so that in the end position the palms of the hands face towards the body or the dumbbell is held in an underhand grip will bend or without outward rotation of the forearms so that in the end position the thumb points to the body or the dumbbell is held in the neutral hammer grip.

Neither bend the arms to the maximum nor straighten them completely.

In the spuination variant, the forearms are rotated back to the inside during the downward movement.

Correct breathing: exhale when bending, inhale when stretching.

name: Biceps LH Curls
descri ption:
Hold the dumbbell with a grip about shoulder-width apart, arms extended. Bend your arms and bring the dumbbell up in one quick motion. Without a break, the weight is now brought down in a controlled manner. Note that moving up is faster than moving down.

During the movement, the body should not swing. The elbows always stay in place.

name: Body-Ups
description:
Take a plank position on the floor. You should be supporting your body weight on your toes and forearms and keeping your torso straight. Your forearms should be shoulder width apart. This will be your starting position.

Press your palms firmly into the floor and extend them through your elbows to lift your body off the floor. Keep your upper body rigid as you perform the movement.

Slowly lower your forearms back to the floor by bending your elbows.

Repeat Process as needed.

name: Body-Ups
description:
1. Assume a plank position on the ground. You should be supporting your bodyweight on your toes and forearms, keeping your torso straight. Your forearms should be shoulder-width apart. This will be your starting position.
  2. Pressing your palms firmly into the ground, extend through the elbows to raise your body from the ground. Keep your torso rigid as you perform the movement.
  3. Slowly lower your forearms back to the ground by allowing the elbows to flex.
  4. Repeat as needed.

name: Braced Squat
description:
Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, while standing as tall as you can.

Grab a weight plate and hold it out in front of your body with arms straight out. Keep your core tight and stand with a natural arch in your back.

Now, push hips back and bend knees down into a squat as far as you can. Hold for a few moments and bring yourself back up to the starting position.

name: Bridge On The Ball
description:
Starting position: Up put your back. Place a large exercise ball under your legs and stay in the bridge with your body tense.

Then bend your legs to 91 degrees and lower them back to the starting position.

name: Bulgarian Split Squat
description:
2. Find a stable implement (a bench or a chair) and place the left foot hip-distance in front of the right one. Your core should be engaged, your shoulders should be back and your eyes and chest should face forward.

2. Raise the right leg off the ground and pulace it on the bench behind you.

3. Check your balance and distance between the feet. Your feet should not be on the same line as that will make it difficult to balance.

4. Bend your left knee and lower downward. Maintain position and push upward. The right knee is used only for balance and should bend by itself.

5. Switch the feet and repeat

The exercise can be done without weights, with dumbbells or a barbell.

name: Burpees
description: Jump, lay down on your chest, do a pushup then jump, repeat

name: Burpees
description: Jump, lie on your chest, do a push-up and jump, repeat

name: Butterfly
description: Sit on the seat of the butterfly machine, feet should make good contact with the floor, upper arms should be horizontal to the floor. Squeeze the weights together, avoiding the handles touching. Now go back, the training weight must not be put down.

name: Butterfly
description: Sit on the butterfly machine, the feet have a good contact with the floor, the upper arms are parallel to the floor. Press your arms together till the handles are practically together (but aren't!). Slowly go back. The weights should stay all the time in the air.

name: Butterfly Eng
description: Sit on the seat of the butterfly machine, the feet should make good contact with the floor, the elbows should be at a right angle, the upper arms should be horizontal to the floor. Squeeze the weights together, avoiding the handles touching. Now go back, the training weight must not be put down.

name: Butterfly Narrow Grip
description:
The movement is the same as with a regular butterfly, only that the grip is narrow:

Sit on the butterfly machine, the feet have a good contact with the floor, the upper arms are parallel to the floor. Press your arms together till the handles are practically together (but aren't!). Slowly go back. The weights should stay all the time in the air.

name: Cable Crossover
description: Begin with cables at about shoulder height, one in each hand. Take a step forward so that one foot is in front of the other, for stability, and so that there is tension on the cables. Bring hands together in front of you. Try to make your hands overlap (so that the cables cross) a few inches.

name: Cable External Rotation
description:
Steps:

  1. Start off placing an extension band around a post or in a secure position where it will not release and is at elbow level.
  2. Position yourself to the side of the band and with your hand that is opposite of the band, reach out and grab the handle.
  3. Bring the band to your chest keeping your elbow bent in a 91 degree angle then slowly rotate your arm in a backhand motion so that the band externally rotates out
  4. Continue out as far as possible so that you feel a stretch in your shoulders, hold for a count and then return back to the starting position.
  5. Repeat for as many reps and sets as desired.

name: Cable Woodchoppers
description: Set cable pulley slightly lower than chest height. Keep body facing forward with hips stable. Grab the pulley handle, fully extend your arms and bring your arms forward and across your body. Hold for 2 second at the end of the movement and slowly return to starting position.

name: Calf Press Using Leg Press Machine
description:
Put the balls of your feet on an extended leg press pad. Use your calves to press the weight by flexing your feet/toes into a pointed position, and releasing back into a relaxed position.

This exercise builds mass and strength in the Gastrocnemius and Soleus muscles as well, if not better, than any calf exercise.

name: Calf Raises
description: Calf raises are a method of exercising the gastrocnemius, tibialis posterior and soleus muscles of the lower leg. The movement performed is plantar flexion, a.k.a. ankle extension.

name: Calf Raises on Hackenschmitt Machine
description:
Place yourself on the machine with your back firmly against the backrest, the feet are on the platform for calf raises. Check that the feet are half free and that you can completely stretch the calf muscles down.

With straight knees pull up your weight as much as you can. Go with a fluid movement down till the calves are completely stretched. Repeat.

name: Chin Up
description: The chin-up (also known as a chin or chinup) is a strength training exercise. People frequently do this exercise with the intention of strengthening muscles such as the latissimus dorsi and biceps, which extend the shoulder and flex the elbow, respectively. In this maneuver, the palms are faced towards the body. It is a form of pull-up in which the range of motion is established in relation to a person's chin.

name: Chin-ups
description: Like pull-ups but with a reverse grip

name: Chin-ups
description: Wie normale KlimmzÃ¼ge, aber im Untergriff.

name: Close-grip Bench Press
description: Perform a typical bench press, but hold the bar with your hands approximately shoulder-width apart and keep your elbows close to your body.

name: Close Grip Bench Press
description: Start off laying on the back feet in front of you and holding a dumbbell in each hand elevated above your chest.Slowly lower the dumbbells to your chest, keeping them close together, without touching and hold for a count.Return back to the starting position.

name: Close-grip Lat Pull Down
description: Grip the pull-down bar with your hands closer than shoulder width apart, with your palms facing away from you. Lean back slightly. Pull the bar down towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your sides as you come down. Pull your shoulders back at the end of the motion.

name: Cross-Bench Dumbbell Pullovers
description: Grasp a moderately weighted dumbbell so your palms are flat against the underside of the top plates and your thumbs are around the bar. Lie on your back across a flat bench so only your upper back and shoulders are in contact with the bench. Your feet should be set about shoulder-width apart and your head should hang slightly downward. With the dumbbell supported at arm's length directly about your chest, bend your arms about 16 degrees and keep them bent throughout the movement. Slowly lower the dumbbell backward and downward in a semicircle arc to as low a position as is comfortably possible. Raise it slowly back along the same arc to the starting point, and repeat for the required number of repetitions.

name: Crunch am TRX Oder Auf Ball
description: Beine in die TRX-Schlingen oder auf einem groÃen Ball auflegen und mit den HÃ¤nden unter den Schultern in eine StÃ¼tzposition (Plank) kommen. Dann die Beine anziehen.

name: Crunches
description: Lay down on your back a soft surface, the feet are on the floor. Ask a partner or use some other help (barbell, etc.) to keep them fixed, your hands are behind your head. From this position move your upper body up till your head or elbows touch your knees. Do this movement by rolling up your back.

name: Crunches
description:
Lege dich auf eine Matte mit angewinkelten Beinen. Die FÃ¼Ãe werden irgendwie festgehalten (Partner, Lanhghantel, o.Ã.) und die HÃ¤nde werden hinter dem Nacken verschrÃ¤nkt. Aus dieser Position fÃ¼hre den OberkÃ¶rper so weit nach oben, bis Kopf oder Ellenbogen die angewinkelten Beine berÃ¼hren.

Es ist wichtig, dass dieser Vorgang mit einer rollenden Bewegung durchgefÃ¼hrt wird: die WirbelsÃ¤ule sollte sich Wirbel fÃ¼r Wirbel von der Matte lÃ¶sen. Ein Hohlkreuz ist stets zu vermeiden.

name: Crunches am Seil
description: Nehme das Kabel in die Hand und halte es neben den SchlÃ¤fen fest. Knie dich nun vor dem Kabelzug mit geradem aber nach vorne gebeugtem OberkÃ¶rper hin. Rolle dich mit einer schnellen Bewegung zusammen, die Ellenbogen zeigen zu den Knien. Gehe langsam wieder zur Anfangsposition zurÃ¼ck.

name: Crunches an Maschine
description:
Ablauf wie bei regulÃ¤re Crunches, nur mit zusÃ¤tzlichem Gewicht an der Maschine.

Setzte dich hin, beide FÃ¼Ãe stabil auf dem Boden. Nehme die Gewichte, Kabel, etc. fest und fÃ¼hre eine rollende Bewegung nach vorn (die WirbelsÃ¤ule sollte sich idealerweise Wirbel fÃ¼r Wirbel von der Lehne lÃ¶sen). Kehre langsam in die Ausgangsposition zurÃ¼ck.

name: Crunches an Negativbank
description: Setze dich auf die Negativbank und fixiere deine Beine. Kreuze deine Arme über die Brust und bringe den Oberkörper nach oben, den Kopf dabei nicht nach vorn kippen. Gehe langsam wieder runter.

name: Crunches an SchrÃ¤gbank
description:
Der Ablauf der Ãbung ist im Prinzip wie bei den normalen Crunches, nur legst du dich auf eine SchrÃ¤gbank oder eine andere geeignete FlÃ¤che. Stelle sicher, dass du nicht rutschen kannst indem du die Beine Ã¼ber den Rand anwikelst oder sonstwo festhalten kannst. Halte die HÃ¤nde hinter dem Nacken verschrÃ¤nkt. Aus dieser Position fÃ¼hre den OberkÃ¶rper so weit nach oben, bis Kopf oder Ellenbogen die Knie berÃ¼hren.

Es ist wichtig, dass dieser Vorgang mit einer rollenden Bewegung durchgefÃ¼hrt wird: die WirbelsÃ¤ule sollte sich Wirbel fÃ¼r Wirbel von der Matte lÃ¶sen. Ein Hohlkreuz ist stets zu vermeiden.

name: Crunches on Machine
description: The procedure is very similar as for regular crunches, only with the additional weight of the machine. Sit on the machine, put both feet firmly on the ground. Grab the to the weights, cables, etc. and do a rolling motion forwards (the spine should ideally lose touch vertebra by vertebra). Slowly return to the starting position.

name: Crunches With Cable
description: Take the cable on your hands and hold it next to your temples. Knee down and hold your upper body straight and bend forward. Go down with a fast movement, rolling your back in (your ellbows point to your knees). Once down, go slowly back to the initial position.

name: Crunches With Legs Up
description: On your back, legs extended straight up, reach toward your toes with your hands and lift your shoulder blades off the ground and back.

name: Curl su Panca a 46Â°
description: Bicipiti su panca a 46Â°. Il movimento deve essere completo

name: Cycling
description: Cycling, also called bicycling or biking, is the use of bicycles for transport, recreation, exercise or sport. People engaged in cycling are referred to as cyclists, bicyclists, or bikers. Apart from two-wheeled bicycles, cycling also includes the riding of unicycles, tricycles, quadracycles, recumbent and similar human-powered vehicles.

name: Deadbug
description: Lie on your back, with your hips and knees bent to 91Â°. Raise both arms toward the ceiling. Pull your lower back to the floor to eliminate the gap. Start by pressing one leg out, and tapping the heel to the floor. "As you extend one leg, exhale as much as you can, keeping your lower back glued to the floor," Dunham says. When you canât exhale any more, pull your knee back to the starting position. Make this more difficult by holding weight in your hands, or by lowering opposite arm and leg.

name: Deadhang
description: Deadhang performed on an edge either with or without added weight (adujst edge or weight to adjust difficulty)

name: Deadlifts
description:
Stand firmly, with your feet slightly more than shoulder wide apart. Stand directly behind the bar where it should barely touch your shin, your feet pointing a bit out. Bend down with a straight back, the knees also pointing somewhat out. Grab the bar with a shoulder wide grip, one underhand, one reverse grip.

Pull the weight up. At the highest point make a slight hollow back and pull the bar back. Hold 2 or 2 seconds that position. Go down, making sure the back is not bent. Once down you can either go back again as soon as the weights touch the floor, or make a pause, depending on the weight.

name: Decline Bench Press Barbell
description: Lay down on a decline bench, the bar should be directly above your eyes, the knees are somewhat angled and the feet are firmly on the floor. Concentrate, breath deeply and grab the bar more than shoulder wide. Bring it slowly down till it briefly touches your chest at the height of your nipples. Push the bar up.

name: Decline Bench Press Dumbbell
description: Take two dumbbells and sit on a decline bench, the feet are firmly on the floor, the head is resting the bench. Hold the weights next to the chest, at the height of your nipples and press them up till the arms are stretched. Let the weight slowly and controlled down.

name: Decline Pushups
description: With your feet raised approximately 31cm on a platform, align your shoulders, elbows and hands, then perform regular pushups. This emphasises the clavicular fibers of the pectoralis major.

name: Deficit Deadlift
description:
Preparation

Stand on weight plate, bumper plate, or shallow elevated platform with loaded bar above feet. Squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.

Execution

Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return weights to floor by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Repeat.

Comments

Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances. Gym chalk, wrist straps, grip work, and mixed grip can be used to enhance grip. Mixed grip indicates one hand holding with overhand grip and other hand holding with underhand grip. Lever barbell jack can be used to lift barbell from floor for easier loading and unloading of weight plates.

Barbell Deficit Deadlift emphasizes building strength through lowest portion of Deadlift. Target muscle is exercised isometrically. Heavy barbell deadlifts significantly engages Latissmus Dorsi. See Barbell Deficit Deadlift under Gluteus Maximus. Also see Deadlift Analysis.

name: Defizit Kreuzheben
description:
Vorbereitung

Stellen Sie sich auf eine Hantelscheibe, eine StoÃstangenplatte oder eine flache, erhÃ¶hte Plattform mit einer geladenen Stange Ã¼ber den FÃ¼Ãen. Hocken Sie sich hin und fassen Sie die Stange mit schulterbreitem oder etwas breiterem Ãberhand- oder Mischgriff.

AusfÃ¼hrung

Heben Sie die Stange an, indem Sie die HÃ¼ften und Knie ganz ausstrecken. Ziehen Sie die Schultern oben am Lift zurÃ¼ck, wenn sie abgerundet sind. Bringen Sie die Gewichte wieder auf den Boden, indem Sie die HÃ¼ften nach hinten beugen, wÃ¤hrend Sie die Knie nach vorne beugen. Halten Sie dabei den RÃ¼cken gerade und die Knie in dieselbe Richtung wie die FÃ¼Ãe. Wiederholen.

Bemerkungen

Halten Sie beim Heben die HÃ¼ften niedrig, die Schultern hoch, die Arme und den RÃ¼cken gerade. Die Knie sollten wÃ¤hrend der gesamten Bewegung in dieselbe Richtung zeigen wie die FÃ¼Ãe. Halten Sie die Stange dicht am KÃ¶rper, um die mechanische Hebelwirkung zu verbessern. Griffkraft und Kraftausdauer schrÃ¤nken hÃ¤ufig die FÃ¤higkeit ein, bei starken WiderstÃ¤nden mehrere Wiederholungen durchzufÃ¼hren. Gymnastikkreide, HandgelenkbÃ¤nder, Griffarbeit und gemischter Griff kÃ¶nnen verwendet werden, um den Griff zu verbessern. Gemischter Griff bedeutet, dass eine Hand mit Ãberhandgriff und die andere Hand mit Unterhandgriff gehalten wird. Mit dem Hebelhantelheber kann die Hantel vom Boden gehoben werden, um das Be- und Entladen von Hantelscheiben zu erleichtern.

Unterer RÃ¼cken

name: Diagonal Shoulder Press
description:
You sit at the bench press device, back slightly tilted to the back. The bar should be about 21 cm in front of you. Then you push the bar and take it back again, as you would with a bench press.

In this position you strain your chest muscles a lot less, which is nice if you want to train, but your chest hasn't recovered yet.

Here's a link to a girl on a machine specialized for this exercise, to give a better description than my failing words above.

http://www.schnell-online.de/db_imgs/products/img/t-80400.jpg

name: Dips
description: Greife die Stangen an einer engen Stelle und drÃ¼cke dich hoch. Strecke dabei die Arme nicht ganz aus, dann bleiben wÃ¤hrend des gesamten Bewegungablaufs die Muskeln immer unter Spannung. Beuge nun die Arme und gehe so tief wie mÃ¶glich runter, die Ellenbogen zeigen nach hinten. Du kannst an dieser Stelle einige Sekunden bleiben, bevor du die Ãbung weitermachst.

name: Dips
description: A dip is an upper-body strength exercise. Narrow, shoulder-width dips primarily train the triceps, with major synergists being the anterior deltoid, the pectoralis muscles (sternal, clavicular, and minor), and the rhomboid muscles of the back (in that order).[ 2] Wide arm training places additional emphasis on the pectoral muscles, similar in respect to the way a wide grip bench press would focus more on the pectorals and less on the triceps.

name: Dips
description: Hold onto the bars at a narrow place (if they are not parallel) and press yourself up, but don't stretch the arms completely, so the muscles stay during the whole exercise under tension. Now bend the arms and go down as much as you can, keeping the elbows always pointing back, At this point, you can make a short pause before repeating the movement.

name: Dips Between Two Benches
description: Put two benches so far appart, that you can hold onto one with your hands and are just able to reach the other with your feet. The legs stay during the exercise completely stretched. With your elbows facing back, bend them as much as you can. Push yourself up, but don't stretch out the arms.

name: Dips Zwischen 3 BÃ¤nke
description: Stelle zwei BÃ¤nke so weit ausernander, dass du die HÃ¤nde am Rand der einen und du die FÃ¼Ãe auf der anderen noch knapp draufstellen kannst. Die Beine bleiben wÃ¤hrend der Ãbung ausgestreckt. Beuge nun die Arme und gehe so tief wie mÃ¶glich runter, die Ellenbogen zeigen nach hinten. Hebe den KÃ¶rper wieder, achte aber darauf, dass du die Arme nicht ganz austreckst.

description: Cvik se provÃ¡dÃ­ v Å¡irÅ¡Ã­m postoji nohou se vzpÄraÄskou Äinkou na zadech. Po dosednutÃ­ na box na chvÃ­li uvolnit nohy a nÃ¡slednÄ vÃ½buÅ¡nÄ se zvednout.

name: Duck Walk
description:
Stand with feet at shoulder-width apart. Sit your hips back and bend your knees into a half squat position. Keep your chest up and clasp your hands in front of your chest. Keeping your knees bent in the half-squat position, slowly walk forward a few steps. In the same position, walk a few steps back to the start point.

Keep your chest up and eyes facing forward for the duration of the exercise. Only squat down as far as you feel comfortable.

name: Dumbbell Concentration Curl
description: Sit on bench. Grasp dumbbell between feet. Place back of upper arm to inner thigh. Lean into leg to raise elbow slightly.

name: Dumbbell Floor Flys
description: Lie on the floor with two dumbbells above your shoulders, (arms 16-degrees shy of full extension)With palms facing, lower the weights in an arching motionWhen your elbows hit the floor, pause briefly for a half secondSqueeze the dumbbells back together in an arching motionStop the dumbbells a few inches shy of touching to keep constant tension on pecs

name: Dumbbell Goblet Squat
description:
Grasp dumbbell with both hands at the sides of the upper plates. Hold dumbbell in front of chest, close to torso. Place feet about shoulderwide apart, keep knees slightly bent.

Squat down until thighs are parallel to floor. Keep back straight, bend and move hips backward to keep knees above feet. Return, keep knees slightly flexed. Repeat.

Keep bodyweight on heels and look ahead or slightly above to keep back straight.

name: Dumbbell Incline Curl
description: With elbows back to sides, raise one dumbbell and rotate forearm until forearm is vertical and palm faces shoulder. Lower to original position and repeat with opposite arm. Continue to alternate between sides.

name: Dumbbell Lunges Walking
description: Take two dumbbells in your hands, stand straight, feet about shoulder wide. Take one long step so that the front knee is approximately forming a right angle. The back leg is streched, the knee is low but doesn't touch the ground. "Complete" the step by standing up and repeat the movement with the other leg.

name: Dumbbell Overhead Press
description: Stand upright and keep the back straight.Hold a dumbbell in each hand at the shoulders with an overhand grip. Thumbs should be on the inside and knuckles facing up.Raise the weights above the head in a controlled motion.Pause at the top of the motion.Return the dumbbells to the shoulders.

name: Dumbbell Push-Up
description: Normal Push-ups on Dumbbells, this brings a further range of movement

name: Dumbbell Triceps Extension
description:
Position one dumbbell over head with both hands under inner plate (heart shaped grip).

With elbows over head, lower forearm behind upper arm by flexing elbows. Flex wrists at bottom to avoid hitting dumbbell on back of neck. Raise dumbbell over head by extending elbows while hyperextending wrists. Return and repeat.

name: Einarmiges Rudern KH
description: Nehme eine Flachbank und setze das Knie eines Beines auf ein Ende, das andere Bein ist daneben und leicht angewinkelt. Beuge deinen OberkÃ¶rper nach vorn und benutze deine Hand um dich abzustÃ¼tzen. Der RÃ¼cken macht einen leichten Hohlkreuz. Greife die Hantel mit der freien Hand und hebe sie eng am KÃ¶rper entlang (achte auf die Ellenbogen). Bringe sie langsam nach unten und wiederhole die Bewegung sobald du unten angekommen bist. Wechsle danach die Seite.

name: Einbeinige Kniebeuge / Ausfallschritt Mit Freiem Bein Nach Hinten ErhÃ¶ht
description: Ein Bein nach hinten auf einem Stuhl oder Bank ablegen, mit dem anderen Bein eine Kniebeuge machen. Gewicht optional mit Langhantel auf RÃ¼cken, Kurzhantel in den Armen oder Kugelhantel in BrusthÃ¶he.

name: Einbeinige Kniebeuge (Pistol Squat)
description: Auf einen Bein stehen - und den Po nach hinten fÃ¼hren. Gleichzeitig in die Knie gehen

name: Extenseurs - Face
description:
En face

  1. Tirer
  2. relacher doucement

name: Facepull
description:
Attach a rope to a pulley station set at about chest level.

Step back so you're supporting the weight with arms completely outstretched and assume a staggered (one foot forward) stance. Bend the knees slightly for a stable base.

Retract the scapulae (squeeze your partner's finger with your shoulder blades) and pull the center of the rope slightly up towards the face. A good cue is to think about pulling the ends of the rope apart, not just pulling back.

As you near your face, externally rotate so your knuckles are facing the ceiling.

Hold for one second at the top position and slowly lower.

name: Face Pulls
description:
Die Ãbung trainiert die RÃ¼ckseite der Schulter.

Die AusfÃ¼hrung erfolgt mit dem Seil am Kabelzug. Dabei wird kontrolliert auf das Gesicht zugezogen.

name: Fliegende KH Flachbank
description: Greife zwei Kurzhanteln und lege dich auf eine Bank und strecke die Arme schulterbreit vollstÃ¤ndig aus. FÃ¼Ãe, RÃ¼cken und Kopf liegen fest auf Boden/Bank und geben Halt. Beuge nun leicht die Arme am Ellenbogengelenk und lasse sie mit einer Halbkreisbewegung seitlich runter. Ohne diesen Winkel zu verÃ¤ndern bringe sie wieder nach oben.

name: Fliegende KH SchrÃ¤gbank
description: Greife zwei Kurzhanteln und lege dich auf eine SchrÃ¤gbank und strecke die Arme schulterbreit vollstÃ¤ndig aus. FÃ¼Ãe, RÃ¼cken und Kopf liegen fest auf Boden/Bank und geben Halt. Beuge nun leicht die Arme am Ellenbogengelenk und lasse sie mit einer Halbkreisbewegung seitlich runter. Ohne diesen Winkel zu verÃ¤ndern bringe sie wieder nach oben.

name: Flutter Kicks
description:
-Laying on the back, lift your straightened legs from the ground at a 46 degree angle.

-As your Left foot travels downward and nearly touches the floor, your Right foot should seek to reach a 90 degree angle, or as close to one as possible.

-Bring your R foot down until it nearly touches the floor, and bring your L foot upwards. Maintain leg rigidity throughout the exercise. Your head should stay off the ground, supported by tightened upper abdominals.

-(L up R down, L down R up, x2) ^v, v^, ^v, v^ = 1 rep

-Primarily works the Rectus Abdominus, the hip flexors and the lower back. Secondarily works the Obliques. Emphasis placed on the lower quadrant of the abs.

name: Fly With Dumbbells
description: Take two dumbbells and lay on a bench, make sure the feet are firmly on the ground and your back is not arched, but has good contact with the bench. The arms are stretched in front of you, about shoulder wide. Bend now the arms a bit and let them down with a half-circle movement to the side. Without changing the angle of the elbow bring them in a fluid movement back up.

name: Fly With Dumbbells, Decline Bench
description:
The exercise is the same as with a regular bench:

Take two dumbbells and lay on a bench, make sure the feet are firmly on the ground and your back is not arched, but has good contact with the bench. The arms are stretched in front of you, about shoulder wide. Bend now the arms a bit and let them down with a half-circle movement to the side. Without changing the angle of the elbow bring them in a fluid movement back up.

name: Forward Lunge
description: Start at a standing position. Lift and move one foot forward until your front calf and thigh are at 91 degrees to one another. At the same time, bend your back leg forward while keeping the back foot in place. Return to starting position. Repeat with other leg.

name: Frenchpress KH
description:
Nehme die Hanteln in die Hand, lege dich auf eine Bank und stelle dich so hin, dass ca. 2/4 des Kopfes nicht mehr auf der Bank liegt. Strecke die Arme aus und lasse nun mit einem Bogen die Gewichte runter. Wenn die Hanteln knapp Ã¼ber die Stirn sind, drÃ¼cke sie wieder nach oben.

Es ist wichtig die Ellenbogen wÃ¤hrend der ganzen Ãbung wenig zu bewegen, damit die Trizeps die Arbeit machen.

name: French Press (skullcrusher) Dumbbells
description:
Hold the dumbbells and lay down on a flat bench in such a way that around 2/4 of your head is over the edge. Stretch your arms with the weights and bend them so that the dumbbells are lowered (make sure they don't touch each other). Just before they touch your forehead, push them up.

Pay attention to your elbows and arms: only the triceps are doing the work, the rest of the arms should not move.

name: French Press (skullcrusher) SZ-bar
description:
Hold the SZ-bar and lay down on a flat bench in such a way that around 2/4 of your head is over the edge. Stretch your arms with the bar and bend them so that the bar is lowered. Just before it touches your forehead, push it up.

Pay attention to your elbows and arms: only the triceps are doing the work, the rest of the arms should not move.

name: Frenchpress Ã-Stange
description:
Nehme die Hantel, lege dich auf eine Bank und stelle dich so hin, dass ca. 2/4 des Kopfes nicht mehr auf der Bank liegt. Strecke die Arme aus und lasse nun mit einem Bogen das Gewicht runter. Wenn die Stange knapp Ã¼ber die Stirn ist, drÃ¼cke sie wieder nach oben.

Es ist wichtig die Ellenbogen wÃ¤hrend der ganzen Ãbung wenig zu bewegen, damit die Trizeps die Arbeit machen.

name: FrontdrÃ¼cken KH
description: Setze dich auf eine Bank, stelle die Lehne fast Senkrecht ein. Nehme zwei Kurzhanteln in die HÃ¤nde und bringe sie auf SchulterhÃ¶he, die HandflÃ¤chen und die Ellenbogen zeigen wÃ¤hrend der Ãbung nach vorn. DrÃ¼cke die Hanteln nach oben, achte darauf, dass auf dem hÃ¶chsten Punkt sie sich zwar sehr nahe kommen, aber nicht berÃ¼hren. Bringe die Hanteln langsam auf die Ausgangsposition.

name: FrontdrÃ¼cken LH
description: Setze dich auf eine Bank, stelle die Lehne fast Senkrecht ein. Greife die Langhantel etwas mehr als Schulterbreit und hebe sie auf BrusthÃ¶he. DrÃ¼cke sie nun nach oben, strecke die Arme aber nicht vollstÃ¤ndig aus. Bringe das Gewicht langsam wieder runter, bis sie wie beim BankdrÃ¼cken die Brust kurz berÃ¼hrt.

name: FrontdrÃ¼cken MP
description: Selbe DurchfÃ¼hrung wie mit der Langhantel. Setze dich auf eine Bank, stelle die Lehne fast Senkrecht ein. Greife die Stange etwas mehr als Schulterbreit und hebe sie auf BrusthÃ¶he. DrÃ¼cke sie nun nach oben, strecke die Arme aber nicht vollstÃ¤ndig aus. Bringe das Gewicht langsam wieder runter, bis sie wie beim BankdrÃ¼cken die Brust kurz berÃ¼hrt.

name: Frontheben am Kabel
description: Stelle dich mit dem RÃ¼cken zum Kabel, halte aber genÃ¼gend Abstand, dass du es durch die Beine nach oben ziehen kannst. Greife die Stange, strecke die Arme komplett aus und ziehe das Seil hoch, bis sie waagerecht sind. Bringe dann wieder das Gewicht runter.

name: Frontheben Mit Scheibe

name: Front Kniebeuge
description:
Bei dieser Variante des Kniebeugens werden der Beinbizeps und der GroÃe GesÃ¤Ãmuskel trainiert.

Daneben werden die RÃ¼ckenstrecker und die Abduktoren beansprucht.

name: Front Raises
description:
To execute the exercise, the lifter stands with their feet shoulder width apart and weights or resistance handles held by their side with a pronated (overhand) grip.

The movement is to bring the arms up in front of the body to eye level and with only a slight bend in the elbow. This isolates the anterior deltoid muscle (front of the shoulder) and uses the anterior deltoid to lift the weight.

When lifting it is important to keep the body still so the anterior deltoid is fully utilised; if the weight cannot be lifted by standing still then it is too heavy and a lower weight is needed. It is important to keep a slight bend in the elbow when lifting as keeping the elbow locked will add stress to the elbow joint and could cause injury.

A neutral grip, similar to that used in the hammer curl, can also be used. With this variation the weight is again raised to eye level, but out to a 46 degree angle from the front of the body. This may be beneficial for those with shoulder injuries, particularly those related to the rotator cuff.

name: Front Squats
description: Squats

name: Full Sit Outs
description: (A) Stellen Sie sich auf Ihre HÃ¤nde und Zehen in eine hohe Plankenposition. (B) Verlagern Sie Ihr Gewicht auf Ihre linke Hand, wÃ¤hrend Sie Ihren KÃ¶rper nach rechts drehen. beugen Sie Ihr rechtes Bein hinter sich und strecken Sie Ihren rechten Arm nach oben. Kehre in die Mitte zurÃ¼ck und wiederhole dies auf der anderen Seite. Fahren Sie mit abwechselnden Seiten fort. Machen Sie es einfacher: Heben Sie Ihren Arm nicht an, nachdem Sie Ihr Bein hinter sich gebeugt haben. Machen Sie es schwieriger: Halten Sie Arm und Bein fÃ¼r zwei ZÃ¤hlungen gestreckt.

name: Full Sit Outs
description: (A) Get in high plank position on your hands and toes.( B) Shift your weight to your left hand as you turn your body to the right; bend your right leg behind you and extend your right arm up. Return to the center and repeat on the opposite side. Continue, alternating sides.Make it easier: Donât raise your arm after you bend your leg behind you.Make it harder: Balance with your arm and leg extended for two counts.

name: Fundos Para TrÃ­ceps
description: Levante-se em barras paralelas mantenha pressionado por 2 segundo, abaixe lentamente e controle por 4 segundos, depois volte sem descanso

name: Glute Bridge
description: Lie on you back with your hips and knees flexed, feet on the ground. From this position, raise your butt off of the ground to a height where your body makes a straight line from your knees to your shoulders. To make the exercise more intense, you can add weight by letting a barbell rest on your hips as you complete the motion, or you can put your feet on a slightly higher surface such as a step or a bench.

name: Hammercurls
description:
Greife zwei Hanteln, die HandflÃ¤chen zeigen zum KÃ¶rper. Beuge die Arme und brige die Hanteln mit einer schnellen Bewegung nach oben wobei sie im Unterschied zu den normalen KH Curls nicht um 91 Grad gedreht werden, die HandflÃ¤chen zeigen also die ganze Zeit nach innen. Ohne Pause wird das Gewicht nun kontrolliert nach unten gebracht. Beachte, dass die Bewegung nach oben schneller ist als nach unten.

WÃ¤hrend des Bewegungablaufs darf der KÃ¶rper nicht mitschwingen. Die Ellenbogen bleiben dabei immer an der Stelle.

name: Hammercurls
description:
Hold two dumbbells and sit on a bench with a straight back, the shoulders are slightly rolled backwards. Your pals point to your body. Bend the arms and bring the weight up with a fast movement. Don't rotate your hands, as with the curls. Without any pause bring the dumbbell down with a slow, controlled movement.

Don't swing your body during the exercise, the biceps should do all the work here. The elbows are at your side and don't move.

name: Hammercurls am Seil
description:
Nehme das Kabel in die HÃ¤nde (HandflÃ¤chen parallel, zeigen aufeinander), der KÃ¶rper steht gerade und ist etwas vom Kabelzug entfernt.

Beuge nun die Arme und bringe das Kabel mit einer schnellen Bewegung nach oben. Ohne Pause wird das Gewicht nun kontrolliert nach unten gebracht (Arme aber nicht ganz austrecken). WÃ¤hrend des Bewegungablaufs darf der KÃ¶rper nicht mitschwingen. Die Ellenbogen bleiben dabei immer an der Stelle.

name: Hammercurls on Cable
description:
Take a cable in your hands (palms parallel, point to each other), the body is straight. Bend the arms and bring the weight up with a fast movement. Without any pause bring it back down with a slow, controlled movement, but don't stretch completely your arms.

Don't swing your body during the exercise, the biceps should do all the work here. The elbows are at your side and don't move.

name: Handgelenkstreckung
description: Im Sitzen Unterarme auf die Oberschenkel, HandrÃ¼cken nach oben (Obergriff) und dann Kurzhanteln nach oben bewegen.

name: Hand Grip
description: chrome Hand Flex Grip to build up forearms muscles

name: Handstand Gegen Die Wand
description: Handstand gegen eine Wand zur UnterstÃ¼tzung (Brust zugewandte Wand).

name: Handstand Pushup
description: The handstand push-up (press-up) - also called the vertical push-up (press-up) or the inverted push-up (press-up) also called commandos- is a type of push-up exercise where the body is positioned in a handstand. For a true handstand, the exercise is performed free-standing, held in the air. To prepare the strength until one has built adequate balance, the feet are often placed against a wall, held by a partner, or secured in some other way from falling. Handstand pushups require significant strength, as well as balance and control if performed free-standing.

name: Hanging Leg Raises
description: Hanging from bar or straps, bring legs up with knees extended or flexed

name: Hercules Pillars
description: Grab two cables stand in the middle so both have tension and hold

name: High Knee Jumps
description:
-Start with legs slightly wider than shoulder width

-Drop into a bodyweight squat

-As you hit the bottom of the squat, explode upwards into a jump while simultaneously tucking your knees into your chest midflight. Remain tucked until the apex of your jump.

-Land on both feet, making sure your knees are not locked so as to avoid excessive strain upon your joints. Collect yourself into the next rep as quickly but under control as possible.

name: High Knees
description:
-Start with legs at a comfortable standing width

-Run in place, bringing knees to or above waist level

name: High Pull
description: Use a light barbell, perform explosive lift up starting from underneath knee cap level. Lift/raise explosively using hips, at shoulder level. Tempo: 2112

name: HIIT
description:
Interval Sprints

21 sec Belastung

30 sec Regen.

name: Hindu Squats
description:
Start with your feet shoulder width apart and arms slightly behind your back.

As you descend towards the floor, raise your heels off the ground, while keeping your back as vertical as possible.

Upon attaining the bottom position, touch the hands to the heels.

Then stand up ending with the heels on the ground, arms extended in front of the chest then rowing into the start position.

name: Hip Raise, Lying
description: Lying down on your back, with your feet flat on the floor. Raise your hips up evenly as high as you can and hold for as long as you can.

name: Hip Thrust
description: The bar should go directly on your upper thigh, directly below your crotch. Your feet should be directly under your knees. Push your hips up so that you form a straight line from your knees to your shoulders. Use a pad for comfort.

name: Hollow Hold
description: Get on a mat and lie on your back. Contract your abs, stretch your raise and legs and raise them (your head and shoulders are also be raised). Make sure your lower back remains in contact with the mat.

name: Hyperextensions
description: Lay on the hyperextension pad with the belly button just at the leading edge, the upper body can hang freely. Tense your whole back's muscles and bring your upper body up till it is horizontal, but not more. Go slowly down and don't relax your muscles.

name: Hyperextensions
description: Lege dich auf das Polster so, dass der Bauchnabel kurz vor der Vorderkante liegt, der OberkÃ¶rper hÃ¤ngt frei nach unten. Spanne die gesamte RÃ¼ckenmuskulatur an, und bringe den OberkÃ¶rper nach oben bis er waagerecht ist (nicht hÃ¶her). Gehe nun langsam wieder nach unten (Muskelanspannung nicht vergessen).

name: Incline Bench Press
description: To do slowly, tempo is 4011

name: Incline Dumbbell Flye
description: Use inclined bench. Hold dumbbells straight out to your sides, elbows slightly bent. Bring arms together above you, keeping angle of elbows fixed.

name: Incline Dumbbell Press
description:
• Bench should be angled anywhere from 31 to 45 degrees
  • Be sure to press dumbbells straight upward (perpendicular to the floor)

name: Incline Dumbbell Row
description:
1. Using a neutral grip, lean into an incline bench.
  2. Take a dumbbell in each hand with a neutral grip, beginning with the arms straight. This will be your starting position.
  3. Retract the shoulder blades and flex the elbows to row the dumbbells to your side.
  4. Pause at the top of the motion, and then return to the starting position.

name: Incline Plank With Alternate Floor Touch
description:
Perform the plank with legs elevated, feet on a gymball. Once stabilised, slowly move one foot sideways off the ball, then make it touch the floor, then come back to starting position. Alternate with the other foot.

This is a core exercise.

name: Incline Pushups
description: Regular push with a 31 degree incline.

name: Incline Push-Up With Rotation
description: A normal Incline Push-Up but with a rotation on top.

name: Isometric Wipers
description:
Assume the push-up position with your hands slightly wider than are shoulder width.

Shift your body weight to the side as far as possible to allow the elbow to bend on that side.

Reverse the movement and move completely to the other side.

Return to the starting position and repeat for desired number of reps.

name: Isometric Wipers
description:
Assume push-up position, with hands slightly wider than shoulder width.

Shift body weight as far as possible to one side, allowing the elbow on that side to flex.

Reverse the motion, moving completely over to the other side.

Return to the starting position, and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Jogging
description: Get your shoes on, go outside and start running at a moderate pace.

name: Jumping Jacks
description: A jumping jack or star jump, also called side-straddle hop in the US military, is a physical jumping exercise performed by jumping to a position with the legs spread wide and the hands going overhead, sometimes in a clap, and then returning to a position with the feet together and the arms at the sides

name: Crisscross Cable Pulling
description:
Pectoral muscles

Pectoral deltoid

p>

name: Cable Pulling From Below
description:
-pectoral muscles

-anterior triangular deltoid

name: Cable pull
description: Cable at upper arm height. arm bent. Rotate the forearm inside out in front of the abdomen so that the grip is moved away from the cable pulley.

name: Kettlebell Swings
description:
Hold the kettlebell securely in both hands. Keep your back flat throughout the move, avoiding any rounding of the spine. Keeping your knees "soft", hinge your hips backwards, letting the kettlebell swing between your knees.

You want to bend from the hips as far as you can without letting your back round forwards. Then, snap your hips forwards quickly and standing up straight, locking your body in an upright posture.

The speed you do this will cause your arms and the kettlebell to swing up in front of you. Don't try to lift the kettlebell with your arms. The snapping forwards of your hips will cause the kettlebell to swing forwards through momentum. Depending on the weight of the kettlebell and the speed of your hip movement, your arms will swing up to about shoulder height. At the top of this swing, let your hips hinge backwards again as the kettlebell swings back down to between your legs and the start of the next repetition.

name: KH an Scottmaschine
description: Sit in front of the Scott machine, adjust the height so that your armpits are on the top edge. The upper arms lie parallel on the surface and remain so during the exercise. Pull the dumbbells up as high as you can and bring them back down without pausing. Extend your arms fully.

name: Kick-Backs
description: Stand on a bench, as in a one-armed KH row : one knee and one hand on the bench, the other leg is on the floor giving support. Take the KH, the forearm makes a right angle and points down. Without moving your elbows, bring the weight up.

name: Pull-ups
description: Grasp the pull-up bar with a wide grip, the body initially hangs freely below. Now pull your chest out and bring your body up until your chin is over the bar (or your neck is touching it if you pulled back), now slowly lower and repeat.< /p>

name: Squat
description:
Adjust the barbell holder to such a height that you can easily take it out and put it back in. Prepare yourself:

  • the bar is slightly lower than shoulder height
  • feet are quite apart and pointing slightly outwards
  • the head is back and looks forward/up.
  • the chest is brought out

Now slowly go down, until the thigh forms a right angle, no lower. The knees point slightly outwards, your buttocks backwards. Take a little break and go back up with as much energy as you can muster. After a 3-second pause, go back down.

name: Squat on Hackenschmidt machine
description: Sit on the machine and press your shoulders onto the pad. Your feet are about shoulder-width apart and point slightly outward. Now slowly bend your knees down until, as with the regular squat, there is an angle of about 91Â°. Push yourself back up and repeat the movement. It is important here that you do not stretch your knees out completely.

name: Concentration Curls
description: Sit on the bench. Grasp the dumbbell between your legs. Place the upper arm on the inner thigh. Raise forearm.

name: Deadlift
description:
Imagine yourself standing slightly more than shoulder-width apart of the bar, feet pointing slightly outwards, the bar is directly above and very close to the shin. Bend your knees (also pointing slightly outwards) and tilt your torso (stay straight throughout the exercise). Grip the bar shoulder-width apart with an underhand and an overhand grip.

Now pull the bar up. At the highest point, arch your back slightly and push your shoulders back. Come back down, making sure to keep your back straight and not arching. You can take a short break at the bottom or continue straight away.

name: Landmine Press, One Arm
description:
This exercise can Can be performed either in a parallel or staggered position.

Grasp the end of a barbell while the other end is fixed to the floor and try to push the weight away from you without moving the barbell towards the center of your body. The whole body remains straight and contracted throughout the exercise.

name: Lateral Raises on Cable, One Armed
Lateral -to-Front Raises
description:
-(2) Perform a lateral raise, pausing at the top of the lift (2).< /p>

-Instead of lowering the weight, bring it to the front of your body so that you appear to be at the top position of a front raise. You will do this by using a Pec Fly motion, maintaining straight arms. (3)

-Now lower the weight to your quadriceps, or, in other words, lower the dumbbells as though you are completing a front raise repetition. (4)

-Reverse the motion: Perform a front raise (5), at the apex of the lift use a Reverse Fly motion to position the weights at the top of a Lateral Raise (6) , and finally, lower the weights until your palms are essentially touching the sides of your thighs (7). THIS IS ONE REP.

description:
• You stand in front of the device with your legs slightly apart and grasp the bar Shoulder width from above, arms are stretched.
  • Inhaling, bring the bar up to your thighs, arms g Stay straight (elbows can be slightly bent)
  • Keep your back straight and contract your abdominal muscles.
  • Exhale at the end of the movement

name: Tucked Arm Lat Pulldowns With (Bar)
description: Use the straight bar attachment. Grasp the two ends of the bar with palms down and arms straight in front of you. Pull your hands down toward your hips while keeping your arms straight, then raise them back to the starting position.

description:
Upright sitting position

Bend the upper body slightly backwards

Grasp the bar in the overhand grip

Bar in front of the Pull head down to sternum

Return bar until elbows are slightly bent

Body slightly tilted backwards

no hollow back

Tense trunk muscles

shoulder-width underhand grip

Pull the bar down in front of your head on your chest
