Bar back so far that the elbows are slightly bent

name: Leg Curl
description: The leg curl, also known as the hamstring curl, is an isolation exercise that targets the hamstring muscles. The exercise involves flexing the lower leg against resistance towards the buttocks. Other exercises that can be used to strengthen the hamstrings are the glute-ham raise and the deadlift.

name: Leg Curls (laying)
description: Lay on a bench and put your calves behind the leg holder (better if they are hold on around the lower calves). Hold a grip on the bars to make sure the body is firmly in place. Bend your legs bringing the weight up, slowly go back. During the exercise the body should not move, all work is done by the legs.

name: Leg Extension
description: The leg extension is a resistance weight training exercise that targets the quadriceps muscle in the legs. The exercise is done using a machine called the Leg Extension Machine. There are various manufacturers of these machines and each one is slightly different. Most gym and weight rooms will have the machine in their facility. The leg extension is an isolated exercise targeting one specific muscle group, the quadriceps. It should not be considered as a total leg workout, such as the squat or deadlift. The exercise consists of bending the leg at the knee and extending the legs, then lowering them back to the original position.

name: Leg Extension
description: The leg extension is a resistance weight training exercise that targets the quadriceps muscle in the legs. The exercise is done using a machine called the Leg Extension Machine. There are various manufacturers of these machines and each one is slightly different. Most gym and weight rooms will have the machine in their facility. The leg extension is an isolated exercise targeting one specific muscle group, the quadriceps. It should not be considered as a total leg workout, such as the squat or deadlift. The exercise consists of bending the leg at the knee and extending the legs, then lowering them back to the original position.

name: Leg Extension
description: Seated Leg Extension Machine

name: Leg Press
description: The leg press is a weight training exercise in which the individual pushes a weight or resistance away from them using their legs .

name: Leg Presses (narrow)
description:
The exercise is very similar to the wide leg press:

Sit on the machine and put your feet on the platform so far apart that you could just put another foot in between them. The feet are parallel and point up.

Lower the weight so much that the knees form a right angle. Push immediately the platform up again, without any pause. When in the lower position, the knees point a bit outwards and the movement should be always fluid.

name: Leg Presses (wide)
description:
Sit on the machine and put your feet on the platform, a bit more than shoulder wide. The feet are turned outwards by a few degrees.

Lower the weight so much, that the knees form a right angle. Push immediately the platform up again, without any pause. When in the lower position, the knees point a bit outwards and the movement should be always fluid.

name: Leg Raise
description: The leg raise is a strength training exercise which targets the iliopsoas (the anterior hip flexors). Because the abdominal muscles are used isometrically to stabilize the body during the motion, leg raises are also often used to strengthen the rectus abdominis muscle and the internal and external oblique muscles.

name: Leg Raises, Lying
description: Lay down on a bench and hold onto the recliner with your hands to keep you stable. Hold your legs straight and lift them till they make an angle of about 46Â°. Make a short pause of 1 sec. and go slowly down to the initial position. To increase the intensity you can make a longer pause of 7 seconds. every 5th time.

name: Leg Raises, Standing
description: Put your forearms on the pads on the leg raise machine, the body is hanging freely. Now lift your legs with a fast movement as high as you can, make a short pause of 2sec at the top, and bring them down again. Make sure that during the exercise your body does not swing, only the legs should move.

name: Leverage Machine Chest Press
description: < p>Be sure to adjust seat height so that the handles are towards the bottom of your pectorals.

name: Leverage Machine Iso Row
description: Adjust seat height so that the handles are at the bottom of your pectorals or just below.

name: L Hold
description: Hang onto a pull-up bar and raise your legs straight up until you have a 91Â° angle between your legs and torso (L-shape). Hold the position.

name: L Hold
description: Hold the L position for as long as possible

name: Push-up
description:
The starting position for the push-up is lying on your stomach, the body is stretched. Hands are on the floor a little over shoulder-width apart. The fingers point forward, the thumbs inward. By tensing the arms at the same time, they are stretched and the upper body lifts off the floor. The weight is evenly distributed on the tips of the toes and hands. The head, neck, spine, buttocks and knees are in line and the abdominal muscles are tight. Now both arms are bent at the same time and the upper body is thus lowered until the tip of the nose almost touches the floor. The body remains stretched.

  • When doing a push-up, the head must be in line with the body and your gaze is directed towards the floor.
  • The head must not be tilted back, otherwise there is a risk of strains.
  • The buttocks should neither sag down nor be stretched far up. Body tension prevents the formation of a hollow back.
  • In order to fully train the chest muscles, the exercise must be carried out with the greatest possible range of motion. The training effect is more intense, the lower the upper body is brought to the ground.
  • Do not make jerky movements, but make even movements.
  • The arms are not fully stretched out but also remain in slightly angled in the highest position to keep tension in the chest, shoulders and triceps constant.
  • Exhale as you push up, inhale as you descend.

name: Push-ups Diamond
description: Push-ups with hands together. The hands are placed side by side in such a way that the thumb and forefinger form a diamond (diamond)

name: Long Pulley
description: Sit down down, place your feet on the support points and grasp the bar with a wide grip. Now draw your hands to your navel, not higher. The arms should remain close to the body and the shoulders should be pulled together as much as possible. Slowly and controlledly lower the weight forward until your arms are fully extended.

name: Long Pulley (eng)
description:
The movement is like that of a long pulley with a wide grip.

Sit down, put your feet on the support points and grab the bar . Now draw your hands to your navel, not higher. The arms should remain close to the body and the shoulders should be pulled together as much as possible. Slowly and controlledly lower the weight forward until your arms are fully extended.

name: Long Pulley (low Row)
description: Sit down, put your feet on the supporting points and grab the bar with a wide grip. Pull the weight with a rapid movement towards your belly button, not upper. Keep your arms and elbows close to your body during the movement. Your shoulders are pulled together. Let the weight slowly down till your arms are completely stretched.

name: Long Pulley, Narrow
description:
The exercise is the same as the regular long pulley, but with a narrow grip:

Sit down, put your feet on the supporting points and grab the bar with a wide grip. Pull the weight with a rapid movement towards your belly button, not upper. Keep your arms and elbows close to your body during the movement. Your shoulders are pulled together. Let the weight slowly down till your arms are completely stretched.

name: Low Box Squat - Wide Stance
description: Unrack the bar and set your stance wide, beyond your hips. Push your hips back and sit down to a box that takes you below parallel. Sit completely down, don't touch and go. Then explosively stand up. Stay tight in your upper back and torso throughout the movement.

name: Lying Heel Touches
description:
met de rug plat op on the ground, at a height of 91 degrees. armen naast het lichaam.

1 breng de schouders iets naar boven.

2 buig het bovenlichaam iets naar rechts terwijl je met de right hand de right held aantikt.

3 ga terug to start position.

4 herhaal aan de linkerkant.

name: Lying Rotator Cuff Exercise
description:
This is an Exercise for problems with the levator muscles. Primary Infraspinatus, secondary Teres Minor.

Lying on side. Keep elbow on waist and in 91 dgr angle. Rotate towards stomach. Add weight as fit.

name: Military Press
description: On an SZ-bar grip your hands on the outside of each bend and stand with your arms straight down, pal ms facing your legs. Pull the bar (bending your arms at the elbow) to your chest, and push the bar above your head (arms as straight as possible). Return the bar to your chest by dropping your arms at the elbows. Return the bar to it's original position (stand with your arms straight down, palms facing your legs.)

name: Military Press
description: The military press is a variation of the overhead press weight training exercise using very strict form and no pre-movement momentum.The military press targets the deltoid muscles in the shoulders as well as the triceps. Additionally, it works the core and legs, which the lifter uses to help stabilize the weight.The lift begins with the lifter standing and the barbell on the anterior deltoids. The lifter then raises the barbell overhead by pressing the palms of the hands against the underside of the barbell.

name: Muscle up
description:
The body is then explosively pulled up by the arms in a radial pull-up, with greater speed than a regular pull-up. When the bar approaches the upper chest, the wrists are swiftly flexed to bring the forearms above the bar. The body is leaned forward, and the elbows are straightened by activating the triceps. The routine is considered complete when the bar is at the level of the waist and the arms are fully straight.

To dismount, the arms are bent at the elbow, and the body is lowered to the floor , and the exercise can be repeated.

As a relatively advanced exercise, muscle-ups are typically first learned with an assistive kip. The legs swing (kip) up and provide momentum to assist in the explosive upward force needed to ascend above the bar. More advanced athletes can perform a strict variation of the muscle-up which is done slowly, without any kip. This variation begins with a still dead hang and uses isometric muscle contraction to ascend above the bar in a slow, controlled fashion.

name: Negative bench press
description: Lie down on the negative bench, thighs and back are fixed on the on it. Grasp the bar wide and lower it slowly and in a controlled manner, allowing the bar to briefly touch your body at nipple level. Then press the weight back up until your arms are straight.

name: Negative bench press CH
description: Hold two dumbbells and sit on a negative bench, feet planted firmly on the floor, head resting on the bench. Hold the weights next to your chest at the level of your nipples and push them up until your arms are straight. Lower the weight slowly and in a controlled manner.

name: Negative Crunches
description: Sit yourself on the decline bench and fix your legs Cross your arms over the chest and bring with a rolling movement your upper body up, go now without a pause and with a slow movement down again. Don't let your head move during the exercise.

name: Negative Flies With KH
description:
< p>The exercise is the same as a regular bench:

Take two dumbbells and lie on a bench. Make sure your feet are firmly on the floor and your back is not arched but is making good contact with the bench. Your arms are stretched out in front of you about shoulder-width apart. Now bend your arms slightly and lower them to the side in a semi-circle movement. Without changing the angle of the elbow, bring them back up in one fluid motion.

name: Negative Plank With Alternating Foot Contact
description:
Perform the plank with your legs and feet elevated on a gym ball. Once stabilized, slowly move one foot sideways off the ball, letting it touch the floor, then return to the starting position. Switch to the other foot.

This is a core exercise.

name: Negative Pushups
description: With feet elevated about 31 cm, align your shoulders, elbows and hands on a platform, then perform regular push-ups. This emphasizes the clavicular fibers of the pectoralis major.

name: Upper pulley
description: Grasp the handle of the pulley with outstretched arm from the side press top down until grip is in front of thigh.

name: Plank

Keep your body straight at all times and hold this position as long as possible. To increase difficulty an arm or leg can be raised while performing this exercise.

name: Preacher Curls
description: Place the EZ curl bar on the rest handles in front of the preacher bench. Lean over the bench and grab the EZ curl bar with palms up. Bring the weights back up to the starting point by contracting biceps. Repeat

description:
Lying on stomach with head on towel.

Stretch arms straight out to your sides.

Slowly lift your arms, pulling your shoulderblades together, hold for 4 seconds.

name: Pull-ups
description: Grab the pull up bar with a wide grip, the body is hanging freely. Keep your chest out and pull yourself up till your chin reaches the bar or it touches your neck, if you want to pull behind you. Go with a slow and controlled movement down, always keeping the chest out.

name: Push Press
description: olympic weight lifting

name: Pushups
description: A push-up (or press-up if the hands are wider than shoulders placing more emphasis on the pectoral muscles) is a common calisthenics exercise beginning from the prone position. By raising and lowering the body using the arms, push-ups exercise the pectoral muscles, triceps, and anterior deltoids, with ancillary benefits to the rest of the deltoids, serratus anterior, coracobrachialis and the midsection as a whole. Push-ups are a basic exercise used in civilian athletic training or physical education and commonly in military physical training. They are also a common form of punishment used in the military, school sport, or some martial arts disciplines.

name: Push Ups
description: Start with your body streched, your hands are shoulder-wide appart on the ground. Push yourself off the ground till you strech your arms. The back is always straight and as well as the neck (always look to the ground). Lower yourself to the initial position and repeat.

name: Rack Deadlift
description:
Deadlift to be done using a Smith machine or a free rack. Bar or barbell hould be just right under the knee cap level. Lift using the glutes and through the heels, then come back to starting postion with a control movement of 3 seconds.

This exercise targets mainly the lower back and glutes.

name: Rear Delt Raises
description: Seated on a bench bWith the dumbbells on the floor bend over at 46 Degrees and then slowly raise each dumbbell to shoulder height and hold for a couple seconds before lowering to the starting position.

name: Renegade Row
description:
Get into pushup position gripping some dumbbells. Perform one pushup, then drive your left elbo up, bringing the dumbell up to your body. Return the dumbell to starting position.

Perform another pushup and then row with the other arm to complete one rep.

name: Reverse Bar Curl
description: Hold bar with reverse (or "overhand") grip, palms facing the floor.

name: Reverse Curl
description: The reverse-grip barbell curl is a variation on the biceps curl where the palms face downward. The switch from an underhand to an overhand grip brings the forearm and brachialis muscles more into the exercise.

name: Row
description: In strength training, rowing (or a row, usually preceded by a qualifying adjective â for instance a seated row) is an exercise where the purpose is to strengthen the muscles that draw the rower's arms toward the body (latissimus dorsi) as well as those that retract the scapulae (trapezius and rhomboids) and those that support the spine (erector spinae). When done on a rowing machine, rowing also exercises muscles that extend and support the legs (quadriceps and thigh muscles). In all cases, the abdominal and lower back muscles must be used in order to support the body and prevent back injury.

name: Rowing, T-bar
description:
The execution of this exercise is very similar to the regular bent over rowing, only that the bar is fixed here.

Grab the barbell with a wide grip (slightly more than shoulder wide) and lean forward. Your upper body is not quite parallel to the floor, but forms a slight angle. The chest's out during the whole exercise. Pull now the barbell with a fast movement towards your belly button, not further up. Go slowly down to the initial position. Don't swing with your body and keep your arms next to your body.

name: RÃ¼ckenstrecker im Stehen
description: Ball zwischen die HÃ¤nde klemmen oder Handtuch auseinanderziehen und dann im Stand nach oben mit ausgestreckten Armen Ã¼ber den Kopf ziehen, dabei je Wiederholung abwechselnd ein Bein heben. Die Beine kÃ¶nnen mit einem Widerstandsband verbunden sein.

name: Rudern am Tiefen Block (Seilzug)
description: beim Einatmen den Haltegriff zum Schwertfortsatz des Brustbeins fÃ¼hren. wÃ¤hrend der RÃ¼cken aufgerichtet und die Ellbogen so weit wie mÃ¶glich nach hinten gezogen werden

name: Rudern Aufrecht MP
description:
Der Bewegungsablauf ist derselbe wie bei Ausführung mit einer ß-Stange.

Stelle dich gerade hin, die Füße etwa schulterbreit. Halte die Stange mit einem Obergriff vor den Oberschenkel, die Arme ausgestreckt. Ziehe dann die Stange dicht am Körper hoch, bis etwa zum Kinn. Die Ellenbogen zeigen nach oben, so, dass in der höchsten Position die Arme ein leichtes V machen. Mache nach Möglichkeit hier eine kurze Pause und gehe dann langsam wieder runter.

name: Rudern Aufrecht Ã-Stange
description: Stelle dich gerade hin, die FÃ¼Ãe etwa schulterbreit. Halte die Ã-Stange mit einem Obergriff vor den Oberschenkel, die Arme ausgestreckt. Ziehe dann die Stange dicht am KÃ¶rper hoch, bis etwa zum Kinn. Die Ellenbogen zeigen nach oben, so, dass in der hÃ¶chsten Position die Arme ein leichtes V machen. If possible, take a short break here and then slowly come back down.

name: Rows Tight To Belly
description: Keep your back straight

name: Inclined KH Row
description:
Lean into an incline bench with a neutral grip.

Grasp a neutral-grip dumbbell in each hand and start with straight arms. This will be your starting position.

Retract your shoulder blades and bend your elbows to row the dumbbells toward you.

Hold at the top of the movement and then return to the starting position.

name: Bent forward row LH
description:
Grasp the barbell with a wide (a little more than shoulder width) Grab and bend forward. The upper body is not completely horizontal, but a bit steeper, the head looks forward and the chest is stretched out.

Now pull the weight towards the navel. Don't swing your torso during the movement and keep your arms close to your body as you pull them up. Slowly bring the bar back down.

name: Rows bent over LH reverse
description:
Sequence of movements like normal bent over Rowing, only the hand position is reverse, i.e. the palms face backwards.

Grasp the barbell with a wide grip (a little more than shoulder width) and bend forward. The upper body is not completely horizontal, but a bit steeper, the head looks forward and the chest is stretched out.

Now pull the weight towards the navel. Don't swing your torso during the movement and keep your arms close to your body as you pull them up. Slowly bring the bar back down.

name: Romanian deadlift
description:
Hold the weight (dumbbells or a barbell) in front of your thighs and lower it to the floor by pushing your hips back.

As you lower the weight, keep your shoulder blades drawn together and your chest open and wide .

When the weight is below the knees, push the hips forward and return to the starting position.

name: Run
description: Running or jogging outside in a park, on the tracks,...

name: Run - Interval Training
description: Run and do some interval training such as hill repat, fartlek,..

name: Run - Treadmill
description: Run on a treadmill

name: Russian Twists
description: To perform the Russian twist one sits on the floor and bends both knees while feet are kept together and held slightly above the ground (or put under a stable surface). Ideally, the torso is kept straight with the back kept off the ground at a 46 degree angle with arms held together away from the body in a straight fashion and hands kept locked together like a ball or one can hold a weight to increase the difficulty. Next, the arms should be swung from one side to another in a twisting motion, with each swing to a side counting as one repetition. The slower one moves the arms from side to side, the harder the exercise becomes, working the abdomen that much better. When moving one's arms during the exercise, it is crucial to not stop between repetitions or else one will lose the effect of working the abdomen. As with all exercise, consistent breathing in and out during the exercise is important as one must ensure proper oxygen flow.

name: Incline bench press CH
description: Sit on the bench, your feet are firmly on the floor and provide support, your head is on the bench. Grab the dumbbells and push them up. Bring the dumbbells down until they are next to your chest. Push the weight back up.

name: Incline bench press LH
description: Sit on the bench, the Feet are firmly on the ground and support the head on the bench. Take the dumbbell out of the holder a little more than shoulder width and push it up. Bring the dumbbell down until it just touches your chest. Push the weight back up.

name: Incline bench press MP
description: The same execution as the incline bench press with the Barbell, but in the multi-press: Sit on the bench, your feet are firmly on the floor and provide support, your head is on the bench. Take the bar out of the holder a little more than shoulder width and push it up. Bring the bar down until it briefly touches your chest. Push the weight back up.

name: KH Shoulder Press
description:
• Exercise can be done while sitting or be performed while standing
  • Stretch your back, look straight ahead, tense your lower back and abdominal muscles
  • Do not lower your elbows too far, ideally up to shoulder height

name: Shoulder press LH
description: Seated shoulder press with barbell

name: Scissors
description: Scissors is an abdominal exercise that strengthens the transverse abdominals , helping flatten your belly and strengthen your entire core. Scissors is not only a core strength move, but it is also a great stretch for your hamstrings and your lower back. Everyone is looking for new ways to work the core, to flatten the belly and to improve flexibility. If you learn how to do Scissors you will get everything rolled together in one move.

name: Scott Curl KH
description: Above the board to isolate the bicep

name: Seated Hip Adduction
description:
Preparation
Sit on seat and lift one leg onto padded lever. Lean back onto back pad. Grasp handles attached to leg levers. Push handles together and raise other leg onto other padded lever. Release leg lever handles and grasp other handles to each side.

Execution
Move legs together until leg levers make contact. Allow legs to separate far apart until slight stretch and repeat.

name: Seated Triceps Press
description: Sit down on a back (better with back support). Take a dumbbell firmly with both hands and hold it with extended arms over your head. With your palms facing upward and holding the weight of the dumbbell, slowly lower the weight behind your head.

name: Side raises
description:
1. Stand upright, head forward, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
  2. Palms facing inward, toward the body.
  3. Raise the dumbbells up to the side without gaining momentum. exhale The elbows are slightly bent. Raise the dumbbells until your arms are parallel to the floor.
  4. At the top, your palms should be facing down.
  5. At the top, hold for 2-2 Pause for a few seconds and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
  6. Slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position and breathe in.

name: Cable Lateral Raise, One Arm
description: Stand upright next to a cable pulley and hold on with one hand, with the other you take the cable handle. Now raise your arm with the weight to the side, but don't stretch it out. Only move that arm during the exercise, don't swing or twist your torso. At the highest point you do 2sec. Pause and then go down slowly. When your hand is just in front of your body, bring the weight back up.

name: Side raise KH
description:
position Stand up with two dumbbells with your legs shoulder-width apart and your feet pointing slightly outwards. The arms are almost fully extended. Now raise the dumbbells sideways, on the highest point you can take a short (2-2 sec.) break.

Make sure that the palms do not rotate during the movement, they should so always point to the ground or to the body.

name: Bended Dumbbell Lateral Raise
description: Sitting on a bench, bend With the dumbbells on the floor, bend yourself 46 degrees, then slowly raise the dumbbells to shoulder height and hold for a few seconds before lowering to the starting position.

name: Side upper body bends on the machine
description:
Target muscles: Obliques

Supporting muscles: Rectus abdominis

Equipment required: Roman Chair

  • Straight body in starting position< /li>
  • Bend the upper body towards the floor
  • When the upper body is approximately parallel to the floor, begin the upward movement
  • Hands either behind the head or in front of the chest

name: Side Upper Body Bends With KH
description:
Target muscles: Obliques

Supporting muscles: rectus abdominis

name: Shotgun Row
description:
1. Attach a single handle to a low cable.
  2. After selecting the correct weight, stand a couple feet back with a wide split stance. Your arm should be extended and your shoulder forward. This will be your starting position.
  3. Perform the movement by retracting the shoulder and flexing the elbow. As you pull, supinate the wrist, turning the palm upward as you go.
  4. After a brief pause, return to the starting position.

name: Shoulder Fly
description: The shoulder fly (also known as a lateral raise) works the deltoid muscle of the shoulder. The movement starts with the arms straight, and the hands holding weights at the sides or in front of the body. Body is in a slight forward-leaning position with hips and knees bent a little. Arms are kept straight or slightly bent, and raised through an arc of movement in the coronal plane that terminates when the hands are at approximately shoulder height. Weights are lowered to the starting position, completing one rep. When using a cable machine the individual stands with the coronal plane in line with the pulley, which is at or near the ground.[ 10] The exercise can be completed one shoulder at a time (with the other hand used to stabilize the body against the weight moved), or with both hands simultaneously if two parallel pulleys are available.

name: Shoulder Press, Barbell
description: Sit on a bench, the back rest should be almost vertical. Take a barbell with a shoulder wide grip and bring it up to chest height. Press the weight up, but don't stretch the arms completely. Go slowly down and repeat.

name: Shoulder Press, Dumbbells
description: Sit on a bench, the back rest should be almost vertically. Take two dumbbells and bring them up to shoulder height, the palms and the elbows point during the whole exercise to the front. Press the weights up, at the highest point they come very near but don't touch. Go slowly down and repeat.

name: Shoulder Press, on Multi Press
description:
The exercise is basically the same as with a free barbell:

Sit on a bench, the back rest should be almost vertically. Take a bar with a shoulder wide grip and bring it down to chest height. Press the weight up, but don't stretch the arms completely. Go slowly down and repeat.

name: Shoulder Shrug
description: The shoulder shrug (usually called simply the shrug) is an exercise in weight training used to develop the upper trapezius muscle. The lifter stands erect, hands about shoulder width apart, and raises the shoulders as high as possible, and then lowers them, while not bending the elbows, or moving the body at all. The lifter may not have as large a range of motion as in a normal shrug done for active flexibility. It is usually considered good form if the slope of the shoulders is horizontal in the elevated position.

name: Shrugs, Barbells
description:
Take a barbell and stand with a straight body, the arms are hanging freely in front of you. Lift from this position the shoulders as high as you can, but don't bend the arms during the movement. On the highest point, make a short pause of 2 or 2 seconds before returning slowly to the initial position.

When training with a higher weight, make sure that you still do the whole movement!

name: Shrugs, Dumbbells
description:
Stand with straight body, the hands are hanging freely on the side and hold each a dumbbell . Lift from this position the shoulders as high as you can, but don't bend the arms during the movement. On the highest point, make a short pause of 2 or 2 seconds before returning slowly to the initial position.

When training with a higher weight, make sure that you still do the whole movement!

name: Shrugs (shoulder raises) with KH
description:
Stand with your upper body straight, hands hanging free and holding one dumbbell each. From this position, raise your shoulders as high as you can, but don't bend your arms during the exercise. Am hÃ¶chsten Punkt kannst du eine oder zwei Sekunden Pause machen bevor du langsam wieder runtergehst.

Bei grÃ¶Ãerem Gewicht, beachte immer, dass du immer noch die volle Bewegungsamplitude durchfÃ¼hren kannst.

name: Shrugs (Schulterheben) Mit LH
description:
Stelle dich mit geradem OberkÃ¶rper hin, die HÃ¤nde hÃ¤ngen frei nach unten und halten die Langhantel. Hebe aus dieser Position die Schultern so weit nach oben, wie es geht, beuge aber die Arme wÃ¤hrend der Ãbung nicht. Am hÃ¶chsten Punkt kannst du eine oder zwei Sekunden Pause machen bevor du langsam wieder runtergehst.

Bei grÃ¶Ãerem Gewicht, beachte immer, dass du immer noch die volle Bewegungsamplitude durchfÃ¼hren kannst.

name: Shrugs (Schulterheben) Mit MP
description: Greife die Stange der Multipresse, stelle dich mit Schulterbreitem Stand und sehr leicht gebeugte Beine auf und lasse den Blick nach vorn. Die Arme hÃ¤ngen am KÃ¶rper. Aus dieser Position hebst du nun das Gewicht, indem du die Schultern nach oben ziehst. Beuge dabei die Arme nicht. Auf dem hÃ¶chsten Punkt kannst du 2 oder 2 Sekunden ausharren, bringe dann die Schultern langsam nach unten.

name: Side Crunch
description: Hold weight in one hand. Bend side ways to the knee. Pull upo to upright position using your obliquus.

name: Side Dumbbell Trunk Flexion
description: AKA dumbbell side bends. Stand in line with the hips with slightly bent knees, maintain the natural curvature of the spine, hand stretched by the body, grip the barbell with one hand. Make slow and controlled torso side flexions till you reach the angle of approximately 46Â°.

name: Side-lying External Rotation
description:
With a weight in one hand, lie on your side opposite the weight. Keep your knees slightly bent. Hold your elbow against your side, and extend your upper arm straight ahead of you. While continuing to hold your elbow against your side, rotate your upper arm 91 degrees upwards.

It is helpful to place a towel under your armpit to help with the form on this exercise. Placing a support under your head for the duration of the exercise is also a good idea.

name: Side Plank
description: Works your obliques and helps stabilize your spine. Lie on your side and support your body between your forearm and knee to your feet.

name: Side Plank
description: Legen Sie sich auf die Seite und stÃ¼tzen Sie Ihren KÃ¶rper zwischen Unterarm und Knie bis zu den FÃ¼Ãen.

name: Side Raise
description:
Stand up or sit , keep both weights in front against legs or at side. Keep arms at around a 91 degree angle. Lift elbows up slowly and squeese traps when at topmost position. Lower the weights slowly back to starting position.

2 seconds up, 2 seconds down

name: Side to Side Push Ups
description:
-start in push up position

-lean the body weight to the right side, and complete a push up with the chest over the right hand

-come back to the centered position

-on rep 3, lean to the left side

name: Single-arm Preacher Curl
description: Sit on the preacher curl bench and perform a bicep curl with a dumbbell in one hand. Your other hand can be at rest, or beneath your curling arm's elbow.

name: Sitting Calf Raises
description: Sit on a bench for calf raises and check that the feet are half free and that you can completely stretch the calf muscles down. Pull your calves up, going as far (up) as you can. Make at the highest point a short pause of 2 or 2 seconds and go down.

name: Sit-ups
description: Sit on a mat, your calves are resting on a bench, the knees make a right angle. Hold your hands behind your neck. Go now up with a rolling movement of your back, you should feel how the individual vertebrae lose contact with the mat. At the highest point, contract your abs as much as you can and hold there for 3 sec. Go now down, unrolling your back.

name: Sit Ups
description: Lege dich auf eine Matte, die Knie sind rechtwiklig angewinkelt und die Fersen liegen auf eine Bank. Die HÃ¤nde sind hinter dem Nacken. Das Hochgehen wird mit einer rollenden Bewegung durchgefÃ¼hrt: die WirbelsÃ¤ule sollte sich Wirbel fÃ¼r Wirbel von der Matte lÃ¶sen. Ein Hohlkreuz ist stets zu vermeiden. Auf der hÃ¶chsten Stelle sollten die Muskeln etwa 3 sek. maximal angespannt werden bevor die rollende Bewegung in der Gegenrichtung durchgefÃ¼hrt wird.

name: Skipping - Standard
description:
Do a single, double footed jump for each swing of the rope.

Work on a smooth, rhythmical movement, bouncing lightly on the balls of your feet.

name: Smith Machine Close-grip Bench Press
description: Perform a standard bench press on the smith machine, but have your hands on the bar about shoulder width apart, and keep your elbows close to your body.

name: Snach
description: Stand with your feet at hip width and your shins against the bar. Grasp the bar at double shoulder width and, keeping your lower back flat, drive your heels into the floor to begin lifting the bar. When it's above your knees, explosively extend your hips and shrug your shoulders. Let the momentum carry the weight overhead.

name: Speed Deadlift
description: Deadlift with short (<2min) rest between sets.

name: Splinter Sit-ups
description: Lie on your back with your legs straight and arms at your sides, keeping your elbows bent at 91 degrees. As you sit up, twist your upper body to the left and bring your left knee toward your right elbow while you swing your left arm back. Lower your body to the starting position, and repeat to your right. That's 1 rep.

name: Squat Jumps
description: Jump wide, then close

name: Squats
description:
Make sure you have put the barbell at a height where you can comfortably take it out and put it back in. Take it out and make yourself ready:

  • The bar is somewhat lower than your shoulders
  • The feet are quite apart and point out
  • The head is in your neck and looks up
  • The chest is out

Go now slowly down, till your thighs are parallel with the floor, not lower. The knees point outwards, your butt, out. Make a small pause of 2 second and with as much energy as you can, push the weight up. Make a pause of 2 seconds and repeat.

name: Squat Thrust
description: The burpee, or squat thrust, is a full body exercise used in strength training and as an aerobic exercise. The basic movement is performed in four steps and known as a four-count burpee: Begin in a standing position. Move into a squat position with your hands on the ground. (count 2) Kick your feet back into a plank position, while keeping your arms extended. (count 2) Immediately return your feet into squat position. (count 3) Stand up from the squat position (count 4)

name: Standing Bicep Curl
description: Stand holding dumbbells at shoulder width apart. Face forearm upward and keep upper arm still while raising each dumbbell up to your shoulder.

name: Standing Calf Raises
description: Get onto the calf raises machine, you should able to completely push your calves down. Stand straight, don't make a hollow back and don't bend your legs. Pull yourself up as high as you can. Make a small pause of 2 - 2 seconds and go slowly down.

name: Standing Rope Forearm
description: Grab a wrist roller tool with both hands while standing with your feet about shoulder width apart. If your gym does not have a wrist roller tool, you can easily put one together. All you need is a 6 or 10 pound weight plate, a strong thin rope about 3 feet long and a 6-8 inch stick or bar. Securely fasten the rope to the middle of the bar/stick and tie the other end of the rope to the weight plate. To begin this exercise, grab the bar/stick with both hands using an overhand grip. Extend both arms straight out in front of you, parallel to the floor. Next, roll the weight up from the floor by rapidly twisting the bar/stick with your hands and wrists. Once the weight reaches the top, slowly lower the plate back to the floor by reversing the motion of your hands and wrists. Repeat (if you can!).

name: Stationary Bike
description: Ride a Stationary Bike with various tensions.

name: Stiff-legged Deadlifts
description:
• Keep legs straight
  • Keep back straight

name: Straight-arm Pull Down (bar Attachment)
description: Use the straight bar attachment on a high pulley. Grasp the two ends of the bar with your palms facing downward and your arms straight out in front of you. Pull your hands down towards your hips, while keeping your arms straight, then raise them back up to the starting position.

name: Straight-arm Pull Down (rope Attachment)
description: Use the rope attachment on a high pulley. Grasp the two ends of the rope with your arms straight out in front of you. Pull your hands down towards your hips, while keeping your arms straight, then raise them back up to the starting position.

name: Sumo Deadlift
description:
1. Begin with a bar loaded on the ground. Approach the bar so that the bar intersects the middle of the feet. The feet should be set very wide, near the collars. Bend at the hips to grip the bar. The arms should be directly below the shoulders, inside the legs, and you can use a pronated grip, a mixed grip, or hook grip. Relax the shoulders, which in effect lengthens your arms.
  2. Take a breath, and then lower your hips, looking forward with your head with your chest up. Drive through the floor, spreading your feet apart, with your weight on the back half of your feet. Extend through the hips and knees.
  3. As the bar passes through the knees, lean back and drive the hips into the bar, pulling your shoulder blades together.
  4. Return the weight to the ground by bending at the hips and controlling the weight on the way down.

name: Sumo Squats
description:
Stand with your feet wider than your shoulders, with your toes pointed out at a 46 degree angle and barbell on your shoulder.

While keeping your back straight, descend slowly by bending at the knees and hips as if you are sitting down (squatting).

Lower yourself until your quadriceps and hamstrings are parallel to the floor.

Return to the starting position by pressing upwards and extending your legs while maintaining an equal distribution of weight on your forefoot and heel.

name: Sumo Squats (PilÃ© Squats) Kniebeuge
description:
Variante der Kniebeuge: breiter Stand, FÃ¼Ãe leicht nach auÃen

Optional mit Langhantel oder Kettlebell (Kugelhantel) vor der Brust

name: Superman
description: Legen Sie sich flach auf den Bauch und strecken Sie die Arme vor sich auf den Boden, wÃ¤hrend Ihre Beine flach liegen. Heben Sie beide Arme und Beine gleichzeitig an, als ob Sie fliegen wÃ¼rden, und ziehen Sie den unteren RÃ¼cken zusammen. Stellen Sie sicher, dass Sie atmen und halten Sie die Bewegung, abhÃ¤ngig von Ihrer Fitness, mindestens zwei bis fÃ¼nf Sekunden pro Wiederholung.

name: Superman
description: Lay flat on your stomach with your arms extended in front of you on the ground as your legs are lying flat. Lift both your arms and legs at the same time, as if you were flying, and contract the lower back. Make sure that you are breathing and, depending on your fitness level, hold the movement for at least two to five seconds per repetition.

name: T-Bar Rudern (breit)
description:
Die AusfÃ¼hrung ist sehr Ã¤hnlich wie beim freien vorgebeugtem Rudern, nur ist hier die Stange fest.

Stelle dich auf das GerÃ¤t in die entsprechende Stelle und greife die Gewichtsstange mit mittelbreitem Griff. Gehe etwas in die Knie, bringe die Brust raus und fÃ¼hre den OberkÃ¶rper nach vorne. Hebe das Gewicht und ziehe es in Richtung Bauchnabel hoch (Ellenbogen am KÃ¶rper lassen). Then slowly lower it back down, feeling the stretch in your lower back muscles.

name: Thruster
description:
1. Start by doing a front squat
  2. At the top position, push the bar above your head (similar to a press)
  3. Lower the bar to the shoulders

name: Deep tuck jumps
description: 6 Seconds parallel to the floor with thighs. Then jump up and enter the starting phase. Arms crossed behind head the whole time.

name: Tricep Dumbbell Kickback
description:
1. Start with a dumbbell in each hand and your palms facing your torso. Keep your back straight with a slight bend in the knees and bend forward at the waist. Your torso should be almost parallel to the floor. Make sure to keep your head up. Your upper arms should be close to your torso and parallel to the floor. Your forearms should be pointed towards the floor as you hold the weights. There should be a 91-degree angle formed between your forearm and upper arm. This is your starting position.
  2. Now, while keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and use your triceps to lift the weights until the arm is fully extended. Focus on moving the forearm.
  3. After a brief pause at the top contraction, inhale and slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
  4. Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

Variations: This exercise can be executed also one arm at a time much like the one arm rows are performed.

Also, if you like the one arm variety, you can use a low pulley handle instead of a dumbbell for better peak contraction. In this case, the palms should be facing up (supinated grip) as opposed to the torso (neutral grip).

name: Triceps Bench Press One Barbell

name: Triceps Dips
description: lift on parallel bars hold for 2 second, and lower slowly and control for 4 seconds, then come back with no rest (tempo: 4010)

name: Triceps Extensions on Cable
description: Grab the cable, stand with your feet shoulder wide, keep your back straight and lean forward a little. Push the bar down, making sure the elbows don't move during the exercise. Rotate your hands outwards at the very end and go back to the initial position without pause.

name: Triceps Extensions on Cable With Bar
description: Grab the bar, stand with your feet shoulder wide, keep your back straight and lean forward a little. Push the bar down, making sure the elbows don't move during the exercise. Without pause go back to the initial position.

name: Tricep extension Overhead CH
description: Sit on a bench and grab a dumbbell. Extend your arm almost fully and slowly lower the weight behind your head. During the exercise only the triceps are allowed to do the work, make sure that the elbows do not move. You can use your free arm to stabilize yourself.

name: Triceps machine
description: Sit down and grip the bar firmly with your hands . Now push the weight up (do not fully extend your arms) and slowly lower it back down. As with the other tricep exercises, it's important not to move your upper arms.

name: Triceps rope press
description: Stand with shoulder width Standing in front of the pulley, bend your back very slightly forward and grab the rope. Now pull down, keeping your elbows steady throughout the exercise. With your arms extended, turn your hands outward. Slowly return to the starting position.

name: Triceps rope press with bar
description: Stand shoulder-width apart in front of the cable machine, bend your back very slightly forward and grab the bar. Press the weight down, keeping your elbows stationary throughout the exercise. Slowly return to the starting position without pausing.

name: Trunk Rotation With Cable
description: Seated trunk rotation with cable

name: TRX rowing
description: Rowing with sling trainer - bodyweight exercise

name: Turkish Get Up
description: Start on your back and stand with a dumbbell in hand. Switch hands between repetitions.

name: Turkish Get Up
description: < p>Starting on back, move to the standing position with dumbbell in one hand. Switch hands between reps.

name: Underhand Lat Pull Down
description: Grip the pull-down bar with your palms facing you and your hands closer than shoulder-width apart. Lean back slightly and keep your back straight. Pull the bar down towards your chest, pulling your shoulders back slightly at the end of the motion.

name: Forearm Raise
description: WHEN SITTING, REST FOREARMS ON KNEES PALM UP LIFT BARBELLS

name: Forearm brace - plank
description: Lie on the floor with your stomach and support the body with forearms and toes. Legs, back and head should form a straight line.

name: Upper Body
description: Full workout of the upper arms body n chest. Focusing on the core

name: Upper External Oblique
description: Exercise for upper external oblique muscles

name: Upright Row, on Multi Press
description:
The movements are basically the same as with an SZ-bar, but you use the bar on the multi press:

Stand straight, your feet are shoulder-width apart. Hold the bar with an overhand grip on your thighs, your arms are stretched. Lift the bar close to the body till your chin. The elbows point out so that at the highest point they form a V. Make here a short pause before going slowly down and repeating the movement.

name: Upright Row, SZ-bar
description: Stand straight, your feet are shoulder-width apart. Hold the SZ bar with an overhand grip on your thighs, your arms are stretched. Lift the bar close to the body till your chin. The elbows point out so that at the highest point they form a V. Make here a short pause before going slowly down and repeating the movement.

name: Upright Row w/ Dumbbells
description: Feet apart at shoulder width. Nice and slow!

name: V-Bar Pulldown
description: Pulldowns using close grip v-bar.

name: Bending Lateral Raise
description:
Sit on the edge of a flat bench and bend your body forward so that it is parallel to the floor. Now take the dumbbells and lift them sideways to a little above shoulder height. Go back down slowly.

It is important during the exercise not to move your arms forward or backward, they should always be at right angles to your body. As with standing lateral raises, your palms shouldn't rotate, so they're always facing the floor or your body.
